author: Jesus Altamirano

review: I am using Chromecast to replace an HDMI cable that I had been using to play movies and TV shows from the internet onto my TV. I don't have cable so I use this function almost daily. The cable was often left plugged in on the side of my TV and often looked very gawdy and it had started having functionality issues so I started looking at replacement options. I saw chromecast when it came out and was very interested, but I decided to wait until sometime had passed. Now that I have it, I wish I had gotten it sooner. I have been using it to play youtube videos (love the TV queue) and videos from the web and it works great. I uninstalled silverlight so amazon instant videos work and they work great. The other sites I use for streaming work as well as they did before and it is much more convenient. The thing that really surprised me was that I could stream videos from my desktop. Before I was using a laptop to connect the HDMI cable and was expecting the same from Chromecast. I tried my desktop on a whim and it worked like a charm. My desktop is on the older side, although it is lean and works well, and streams just as well as the much newer laptop. Real Cloud Player has worked really well with playing local video's from my phone and computers, still haven't found anything for pictures, but I have also never been interested in showing pictures, at least not yet. Overall I like chromecast very much and wouldn't hesitate to buy again.
